query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Ora sen va per un secreto calle, 2 tra ’l muro de la terra e li martìri, 3 lo mio maestro, e io dopo le spalle.
query.result: 1 Now he goes by a secret path, 2 between the city wall and the martyrs, 3 my master in front, and I behind.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 «O virtù somma, che per li empi giri 5 mi volvi», cominciai, «com’ a te piace, 6 parlami, e sodisfammi a’ miei disiri.
query.result: 4 "O supreme power, who through the impious circles 5 have turned me around, as it pleases you, 6 speak to me, and satisfy my desires.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 La gente che per li sepolcri giace 8 potrebbesi veder? già son levati 9 tutt’ i coperchi, e nessun guardia face».
query.result: 7 Could the people who lie in the sepulchers 8 be seen? All the lids have already been lifted, 9 and no one is guarding them."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 E quelli a me: «Tutti saran serrati 11 quando di Iosafàt qui torneranno 12 coi corpi che là sù hanno lasciati.
query.result: 10 And those to me: "All will be closed 11 when they return here from Jehoshaphat 12 with the bodies that they left up there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Suo cimitero da questa parte hanno 14 con Epicuro tutti suoi seguaci, 15 che l’anima col corpo morta fanno.
query.result: 13 On this side have their cemetery 14 with Epicurus all his followers, 15 who make the soul die with the body.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Però a la dimanda che mi faci 17 quinc’ entro satisfatto sarà tosto, 18 e al disio ancor che tu mi taci».
query.result: 16 Therefore, the demand that you make of me 17 will soon be satisfied here within, 18 and also the desire that you keep silent about."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 E io: «Buon duca, non tegno riposto 20 a te mio cuor se non per dicer poco, 21 e tu m’hai non pur mo a ciò disposto».
query.result: 19 And I: "Good leader, I keep my heart hidden from you 20 only to say little, 21 and you have just now disposed me to do so."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 «O Tosco che per la città del foco 23 vivo ten vai così parlando onesto, 24 piacciati di restare in questo loco.
query.result: 22 "O Tuscan, who through the city of fire 23 go thus speaking so honestly, 24 may it please you to remain in this place.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 La tua loquela ti fa manifesto 26 di quella nobil patrïa natio, 27 a la qual forse fui troppo molesto».
query.result: 25 Your speech reveals you 26 to be a native of that noble fatherland, 27 to which perhaps I was too troublesome."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Subitamente questo suono uscìo 29 d’una de l’arche; però m’accostai, 30 temendo, un poco più al duca mio.
query.result: 28 Suddenly this sound issued 29 from one of the tombs; therefore I drew near, 30 fearing, a little closer to my leader.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Ed el mi disse: «Volgiti! Che fai? 32 Vedi là Farinata che s’è dritto: 33 da la cintola in sù tutto ’l vedrai».
query.result: 31 And he said to me: "Turn around! What are you doing? 32 See there Farinata who has risen up: 33 from the waist up you will see him all."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Io avea già il mio viso nel suo fitto; 35 ed el s’ergea col petto e con la fronte 36 com’ avesse l’inferno a gran dispitto.

Please translate each line literally into English.
37 E l’animose man del duca e pronte 38 mi pinser tra le sepulture a lui, 39 dicendo: «Le parole tue sien conte».
query.result: 37 And the spirited and ready hands of the leader 38 pushed me through the sepulchers toward him, 39 saying: "Let your words be measured."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Com’ io al piè de la sua tomba fui, 41 guardommi un poco, e poi, quasi sdegnoso, 42 mi dimandò: «Chi fuor li maggior tui?».
query.result: 40 As I stood at the foot of his tomb, 41 he looked at me for a while, and then, almost disdainfully, 42 he asked me: "Who were your ancestors?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 poi disse: «Fieramente furo avversi 47 a me e a miei primi e a mia parte, 48 sì che per due fïate li dispersi».
query.result: 46 then he said: "They were fiercely hostile 47 to me and my ancestors and my party, 48 so that twice I scattered them."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 «S’ei fur cacciati, ei tornar d’ogne parte», 50 rispuos’ io lui, «l’una e l’altra fïata; 51 ma i vostri non appreser ben quell’ arte».

Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Allor surse a la vista scoperchiata 53 un’ombra, lungo questa, infino al mento: 54 credo che s’era in ginocchie levata.
query.result: 52 Then a shade rose into the uncovered view, 53 beside the other one, up to its chin: 54 I believe it had risen to its knees.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Dintorno mi guardò, come talento 56 avesse di veder s’altri era meco; 57 e poi che ’l sospecciar fu tutto spento,

58 piangendo disse: «Se per questo cieco 59 carcere vai per altezza d’ingegno, 60 mio figlio ov’ è? e perché non è teco?».
query.result: 58 weeping it said: "If through this blind 59 prison you go because of the loftiness of your genius, 60 where is my son? And why is he not with you?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 E io a lui: «Da me stesso non vegno: 62 colui ch’attende là, per qui mi mena 63 forse cui Guido vostro ebbe a disdegno».
query.result: 61 And I to him: "I do not come of my own accord: 62 he who waits over there, leads me here, 63 perhaps the one whom your Guido held in disdain."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Le sue parole e ’l modo de la pena 65 m’avean di costui già letto il nome; 66 però fu la risposta così piena.

Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Di sùbito drizzato gridò: «Come? 68 dicesti “elli ebbe”? non viv’ elli ancora? 69 non fiere li occhi suoi lo dolce lume?».
query.result: 67 Suddenly straightening up, he cried: "What? 68 Did you say 'he had'? Is he not still alive? 69 Does the sweet light not strike his eyes?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Quando s’accorse d’alcuna dimora 71 ch’io facëa dinanzi a la risposta, 72 supin ricadde e più non parve fora.
query.result: 70 When he realized that I was delaying 71 before answering, 72 he fell back supine and was no longer seen outside.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Ma quell’ altro magnanimo, a cui posta 74 restato m’era, non mutò aspetto, 75 né mosse collo, né piegò sua costa;

76 e sé continüando al primo detto, 77 «S’elli han quell’ arte», disse, «male appresa, 78 ciò mi tormenta più che questo letto.
query.result: 76 and continuing on from his first statement, 77 he said, "If they have learned that art badly, 78 that torments me more than this bed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Ma non cinquanta volte fia raccesa 80 la faccia de la donna che qui regge, 81 che tu saprai quanto quell’ arte pesa.
query.result: 79 But not fifty times will the face of the lady who rules here 80 be rekindled, 81 before you will know how much that art weighs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 E se tu mai nel dolce mondo regge, 83 dimmi: perché quel popolo è sì empio 84 incontr’ a’ miei in ciascuna sua legge?».
query.result: 82 And if you ever return to the sweet world, 83 tell me: why are those people so wicked 84 against my family in each of their laws?"
